frame.name: Victim_operated_IED
frame.definition:
<def-root>An improvised explosive device, the <fen>Bomb</fen>, is placed so as to be hidden from view or disguised as something not harmful. It is rigged to detonate when triggered by actions of an intended Victim. Possible triggering actions include stepping on a pressure-sensitive plate, activating a trip-wire, or moving an object which activates a spring-loaded device.
<ex>We hit a <t>VOIED</t> and the lead truck was destroyed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Bomb
FE.definition: <def-root>The explosive device which activates when set off by the victim.</def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The type of activity that the <fen>Bomb</fen> is generally involved in. Often this can be considered a kind of <fen>Type</fen> specification also.</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates what subtype the <fen>Bomb</fen> belongs to. </def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a part of the <fen>Bomb</fen>. This includes permanent, obligatory parts and mere attachments.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to a <fen>Bomb</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Bomb</fen> comes into existence. </def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual or group responsible for the creation of the <fen>Bomb</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: VOIED.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an explosive rigged to detonate when certain conditions are met by the intended victim.

lexUnit.name: PPIED.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: pressure plate IED; an explosive device which detonates when a nearby pressure plate is depressed by an intended victim.
